item.title: There will be an increase in cyberattacks in the Asia Pacific region in 2015
item.description:
A new cybersecurity report from Trend Micro predicts that criminals will increasingly target retail and financial institutions outside the United States in 2015. The report, Trend Micro Security Predictions for 2015 and Beyond: The Invisible Becomes Visible, anticipates a rise in targeted attacks, specifically in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region. These attacks focus on infiltrating a specific organization to obtain valuable data. High-profile attacks in the US and China demonstrate that cybercriminals favor these targeted attacks to gather intelligence, including financial data, personal information, classified government data, and intellectual property like blueprints...

item.title: Phones become unresponsive due to Android vulnerability
item.description:
Trend Micro has identified a weakness in the Android operating system that can cause a phone to seem non-functional. Affected phones exhibit symptoms like no ringing or notification sounds, an inability to make calls, and an unresponsive screen. Additionally, locked phones cannot be unlocked. This vulnerability affects Android versions from 4.3 (Jelly Bean) to 5.1.1 (Lollipop), encompassing over half of all Android devices currently in use. Despite being reported to the Android Engineering Team in late May, no official fix has been released through the Android Open Source Project (AOSP)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/phones-become-unresponsive-due-to-android-vulnerability/

item.title: Trend Micro advises Windows users to update their operating system to safeguard against the Winshock bug
item.description:
A recently discovered flaw in Microsoft Windows has Trend Micro urging all Windows users to immediately update their systems. The issue exists in Microsoft’s data transfer platform, which is designed for secure communication. Trend Micro warns that users who don’t update are highly vulnerable to attacks, potentially allowing hackers to take control of their systems without any user interaction. This bug, nicknamed “Winshock,” received a severity score of 9.3 out of 10 from the Common Vulnerability Scoring System...

item.title: Before you start shopping online, be sure to check out Trend Micro's shopping tips
item.description:

item.title: Trend Micro cautions that hackers are focusing on small and medium-sized businesses
item.description:
Source: Trend Micro website. Trend Micro warns that hackers are shifting tactics, moving away from mass spamming and towards sending personalized emails containing harmful attachments to compromise businesses. This method, the company cautions, could become the standard attack strategy in the Asia Pacific region. A Trend Micro report titled “Piercing the HawkEye: Nigerian Cybercriminals Use a Simple Keylogger to Prey on SMBs Worldwide” reveals that two Nigerian hackers, known as “Uche” and “Okiki,” are using inexpensive keylogging software called Hawkeye to target small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) globally...
